revdescription.para: The following was done according to #341:
Relay Outputs Using Device IO section and Relay Outputs Using Device IO Test Cases section was moved from ONVIF Device IO Client Test Specification to ONVIF Profile T Client Test Specifications.

section.title: Relay Outputs Using Device IO
section.para: Relay Outputs Using Device IO section specifies Client ability to control of Relay Outputs connected to a device.

section.title: Relay Outputs Using Device IO Test Cases
Feature Level Normative Reference:
section.para: Check Condition based on Device Features: Relay Outputs (Device IO Service) is supported by Device.

listitem.para: Client connects to Device to control of Relay Outputs connected to a device.

Client is considered as supporting Relay Outputs if the following conditions are met:
Client is able to retrieve available Relay Outputs using GetRelayOutputs operation (Device IO Service) AND
Client is able to control Relay Output state using SetRelayOutputState operation (Device IO Service).

Client is considered as NOT supporting Relay Outputs if ANY of the following is TRUE:
No valid response to GetRelayOutputs request (Device IO Service) OR
No valid response to SetRelayOutputState request (Device IO Service).

section.title: GET RELAY OUTPUTS USING DEVICE IO
section.para: Test Label: Relay Output - Get Relay Outputs
Feature Under Test: Get Relay Outputs (RelayOutputsUsingDeviceIO_GetRelayOutputsUsingDeviceIO)
Test Purpose: To verify that relay outputs provided by Device is received by Client using the GetRelayOutputs operation.

listitem.para: The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with GetRelayOutputs operation for Device IO Service present.
Device supports RelayOutputs for Device IO Service (RelayOutputs).
Client supports Capabilities feature.
The Client Test Tool retrives Device IO Service address from device's response on GetServices or GetCapabilities Client request.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes GetRelayOutputs request message to Device IO Service to retrieve relay outputs from the Device.
Device responds with code HTTP 200 OK and GetRelayOutputsResponse message.
Client GetRelayOutputs request messages to Device IO Service are valid according to XML Schemas listed in Namespaces AND

Client GetRelayOutputs request to Device IO Service in Test Procedure fulfills the following requirements:
[S1] soapenv:Body element has child element tds:GetRelayOutputs AND

Device response on the GetRelayOutputs request fulfills the following requirements:
[S2] It has HTTP 200 response code AND
[S3] soapenv:Body element has child element tds:GetRelayOutputsResponse.
The Client failed PASS criteria.

section.title: SET RELAY OUTPUT STATE USING DEVICE IO
section.para: Test Label: Relay Output - Set Relay Output State
Feature Under Test: Set Relay Output (RelayOutputsUsingDeviceIO_SetRelayOutputStateUsingDeviceIO)
Test Purpose: To verify that Client is able to trigger a relay output using the SetRelayOutputState operation.

listitem.para: Device supports RelayOutputs for Device IO Service (RelayOutputs).
The Network Trace Capture files contains at least one Conversation between Client and Device with SetRelayOutputState operation for Device IO Service present.
Client supports Capabilities feature.
The Client Test Tool retrives Device IO Service address from device's response on GetServices or GetCapabilities Client request.

para.emphasis: Test Procedure (expected to be reflected in network trace file):

listitem.para: Client invokes SetRelayOutputState request message to Device IO Service to trigger a relay output on the Device.
Device responds with code HTTP 200 OK and SetRelayOutputStateResponse message.
Client SetRelayOutputState request messages to Device IO Service are valid according to XML Schemas listed in Namespaces AND

Client SetRelayOutputState request to Device IO Service in Test Procedure fulfills the following requirements:
[S1] soapenv:Body element has child element tds:SetRelayOutputState AND

Device response on the SetRelayOutputState request fulfills the following requirements:
[S2] It has HTTP 200 response code AND
[S3] soapenv:Body element has child element tds:SetRelayOutputStateResponse.
The Client failed PASS criteria.
